summary: Too much time spent amidst the rude and uncouth manners of bandits has had a detrimental effect upon your courtesy and bearing.
descriptionHtml:
Project: Boorishness
Author: Zetman
Version: 1.0
Date: [02/28/2015]
Category: Disease

==================
Requirements:
==================

None, just Skyrim itself


==================
Description:
==================

Too much time spent amidst the rude and uncouth manners of bandits has had a detrimental effect upon your courtesy and bearing.  

==================
Details:
==================

This adds a new disease which you can contract from bandits that reduces your speech by 99 points.  

==================
Installation:
==================

------------------------------
Manual Instructions
------------------------------

1) Extract the contents of the ZIP folder into your Data folder
2) Make sure the Boorishness.esp is checked in the Launcher


==================
Known Issues:
==================

None that I could find in testing

==================
Changelog:
==================

[02/28/2015] - Initial Release


==================
Contact Details:
==================

Contact me through the comments section.  


==================
Credits:
==================

Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim.
Thanks to InsanitySorrow for the ReadMe Generator this ReadMe is based on.
Thanks to The Creation Kit Wiki http://www.creationkit.com/Main_Page




==================
Tools Used:
==================

Creation Kit


==================
Licensing/Legal:
==================

You must contact me and obtain my permission before re-packaging any part of this mod.

If I do not respond within 6 weeks, feel free to do whatever you like with this mod.

Do NOT include any part of this mod, including assets, in any project that is asking for or allows donations.


==================
Modder's Will:
==================

If I am offline for six months or longer and do not respond to any attempts made at contacting me, then you are free to upload this project to another site(s) as long as I am credited as the original author.
author: Zetman
